title: You don't need this in 4.2
comment: Android 4.2 (and 4.1?) has a built in CERT manager (System settings -> Security -> Trusted Credentials), so you don't need this. For older versions this works fine.

title: Won't Load Certs!
comment: As mentioned by previous users after granting SU access, it will just say Working Loading, and nothing afterwards except constant error toasts! My phone is Samsung Galaxy S Relay 4G SGH T699 Rooted, running CM10.1 Nightlies Unofficial build. If you figure out and fix problem, I'll be more than happy to reinstall, and re-rate the app 5Stars! I love all your other work like LilDebi, NoteCipher, Giggerbot, GnuPG, ObscureCam, & OrWeb are all awesome apps and straight up must haves!

title: Broken on Android 4.2.x
comment: As per subject, it can't find the keystore in newer android releases.  E/CACert  ( 3245): java.io.FileNotFoundException: /system/etc/security/cacerts.bks: open failed: ENOENT (No such file or directory) E/CACert  ( 3245):  at libcore.io.IoBridge.open(IoBridge.java:416) E/CACert  ( 3245):  at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:78) E/CACert  ( 3245):  at info.guardianproject.cacert.CACertManager.load(CACertManager.java:54) E/CACert  ( 3245):  at info.guardianproject.cacert.CACertManagerActivity.loadKeystore(CACertManagerActivity.java:309) E/CACert  ( 3245):  at info.guardianproject.cacert.CACertManagerActivity.onResume(CACertManagerActivity.java:300) ...  That said, in newer Android releases, you can disable system certs if you wish through Settings -> Security -> Credential Storage -> Trusted Credentials -> System

title: Fail
comment: After granting it root access and accepting the license agreement, it will forever display "Working.. Loading CACert keystore from/system" However, it eventually displays this error notification at the bottom: "Error loading certs:/system/etc/security/cacerts.bks: open failed: ENOENT (No such file or directory)" This is b/c the certs are within /system/etc/security/cacerts (a folder).

title: Doesn't wait for Superuser; needs Add function
comment: Worked the first time I ran it, because the EULA dialog delayed its attempt to retrieve cacerts.bks until after Superuser granted it root access. Subsequent runs dead-ended at the Loading spinner because Superuser apparently doesn't grant su rights fast enough. Also, I really need to add the new GeoTrust root CAs because of sites like imgur switching over, and I would rather not set aside the time to set up a computer to do it. Would be great if this app could import as well as delete.
